item.title: Three EMS stocks to watch in 2026 as India’s electronics manufacturing accelerates

review.headline_rewrite: Three EMS stocks to watch in 2026 as India’s electronics manufacturing accelerates
bullets: #1 Cyient DLM In Q1FY26, the company reported revenues of ₹2,784 million, compared with ₹2,579 million in the same period last year.
Net profit fell to ₹75 million from ₹106 million year-on-year (YoY).
Net profit stood at ₹142 million versus a loss in the year-ago quarter.
Its Q1 FY26 order book rose 22.5% YoY, offering strong revenue visibility.

item.title: Mutual Funds’ favourite, LIC-owned stock Bharat Forge to be in focus today; here’s why

review.headline_rewrite: Mutual Funds’ favourite, LIC-owned stock Bharat Forge to be in focus today; here’s why
bullets: Mutual funds and state-run insurance behemoth, Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) have been increasing their stake in the auto components and defence equipment
Here’s a look at the shareholding pattern: LIC has increased its stake in Bharat Forge during the April-June quarter.
LIC holds 2,36,81,605 shares, representing 4.95% equity stake, in Bharat Forge as of June 2025.
At the end of March 2025, LIC’s stake in Bharat Forge was 4.04%.

item.title: Lenders of bankrupt Jaiprakash Associates to meet Friday; challenge process among 5 bidders likely

review.headline_rewrite: Lenders of bankrupt Jaiprakash Associates to meet Friday; challenge process among 5 bidders likely
bullets: JAL was admitted into the corporate insolvency resolution process (CIRP) through the National Company Law Tribunal, Allahabad Bench, order dated June 3, 2024.

item.title: GST and income tax cuts may lure global funds back to India

review.headline_rewrite: GST and income tax cuts may lure global funds back to India
bullets: India’s policy mix is looking more investor-friendly these days.
Bank of America Corp.’s India Economist Rahul Bajoria points out that urban wage growth has trailed nominal GDP for most of the past two
The result is a squeeze on household demand, even as corporate profits climbed to a 15-year high in FY24.
